website_summaries.verdict: We like this fun, relatively inexpensive model of the iconic Paris landmark.
pros: At just one foot high, this faithful recreation can slip onto most desks or bookshelves
The 321-piece kit looks amazing as a replica of the 1889 World’s Fair centerpiece
Sure to draw approving looks from young and old
cons: Not as challenging as some kits, but a good starter set

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to the LEGO Architecture line.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge LEGO fan, but I'd given up on the Architecture line as they were getting too big and expensive overall. I picked up this set for my daughter, though. For some reason she's a huge Eiffel Tower fan. She assembled it and put it on display on her shelf. We were both impressed with how neat it was, so I went ahead and got one for myself. Minus one star because the build does not stay firm at the top... you have to manually adjust the straightness of the top of the tower, and then leave it alone and make sure not to bother it.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick J. Haab

customer_reviews.title: Have fun!
customer_reviews.text: looks nice in great design. I finish it in 2 hours with 4 more pieces as shown in the picture. Remember the smooth glossy parts always face outside.
customer_reviews.author: Zhang shasha

customer_reviews.title: He does love building and has a creative imagination and enjoys doing ...
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old stepson chose this as a gift. I thought it would be too difficult for him. However, he insisted that this is what he wanted. He does love building and has a creative imagination and enjoys doing puzzles so I hoped he would enjoy this. He loves it. He has since built it and rebuilt it over a dozen times. It came with very clear instructions. It was shipped immediately after purchase and arrived within the time that it was expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product and product line!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Eiffel Tower was my second Lego Architecture model to build. The first was the Burj Khalifa and the third was the Chicago skyline. All of which were fun to build in different ways. Of the three, the Eiffel Tower was the most complex and fun to assemble. The way it all came together utilizing hinges is really cool. When finished, it was indeed the most beautiful of the three. Including frequent breaks the model took about 3 hours to assemble. I have it displayed on my desktop in my office opposite the Burj Khalifa. They complement each other well, the old world meets the new world of architecture. Look forward to building another.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk  Walker

customer_reviews.title: Kept my son busy for hours, worth the money just for that!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son who is absolutely obsessed with everything Lego. My son is 7 and had no issues with building this on his own. I took him a couple of hours and he was pretty proud once he was finished. I urged his to keep it together and display it , as it is most specialty pieces and if just one is missing, he wouldn't be able to build it again. It now sits on my dresser and is quite a cool looking piece. I really love this Architecture line.
customer_reviews.author: C. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Neat Model
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a joke to memorialize a trip to Paris the previous year, but after building it now on display. It's very neat, much different than what I grew up with. For a youngster they may need a little help while building, not overly complex but could be frustrating. The architectural line of LEGO is very interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Fun build for a 14yr old LEGO fanatic
customer_reviews.text: We went on a family vacation to Paris this summer and they had LEGO Paris sets in many stores. The price was crazy especially with the conversion so I told him we would look on amazon when we got home. I’m pretty sure he thought I forgot because he was so surprised and thrilled when I handed him the box. He is a Lego fanatic. He said there were so many small piece and it made the build a challenge which he enjoyed.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle S

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the Architecture series.
customer_reviews.text: I have really anjoyed the LEGO Architecture series, and the Eiffel Tower was no exception. It is a medium difficulty for the series. The instruction manual as always was easy to follow. I had very few times I had to back up to correct a mistake. The booklets that come with the Architecture series give you background information on the structure and its design. I always find them a very interesting read.
customer_reviews.author: Dargon

customer_reviews.title: Fun set for a budding architect!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great introduction set to Lego's Architecture series. Lots of small pieces, so I wouldn't give this to a young kid who gets frustrated too easily, but it comes together nicely and adds to any scene or just as an ornamental piece.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Rod

customer_reviews.title: My kid loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old loves this! We worked on it together as that is something we love to do together but he could have done it easily by himself also. He even brought this and the Great Wall of China one he did for show and tell jen like anthem so much!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: My son loved it
customer_reviews.text: My 9-year-old has built a lot of LEGO sets (Star Wars, Harry Potter, etc.); however, this was his first LEGO Architecture set. I wasn't sure if he'd like it because there were a lot fewer pieces, but he really enjoyed it. We will be getting more.
customer_reviews.author: Patti S

customer_reviews.title: Really Fun
customer_reviews.text: LEGOs are expensive, but this is a very nice set with some fun pieces for extra realism.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: NOT EASY, doesnt stay
customer_reviews.text: I have tried 3 times to put this together. i have done 10-11 architecture series so im not a newbie. it keeps falling apart, push one side, other side pops off. i am now resorting to super glue. rediculous.
customer_reviews.author: Patti W.

customer_reviews.title: Best of the small Architecture series
customer_reviews.text: This is the best of the smaller architecture series. It's sturdy, and slightly over a foot tall. The others in the architecture series are significantly smaller. The substantial size of the Eiffel tower makes it a better show piece. Also, it's more sturdy than the smaller ones. There are two "floating" points, which allows the tower to slightly contort. I'm not sure if this helps the integrity, but it's pretty cool and unique to the Eiffel tower. Like the other smaller architecture series, it's a pretty easy build.
customer_reviews.author: A. Shrestha

customer_reviews.title: Great Lego Set, even for a 9 year old
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 9 year old girl who loves Legos and Paris (her bedroom is Paris themed.) It took her longer to put together than her Lego Friends sets, but she was able to put it together by herself after about 3 days. The finished set is cute-a nice addition to her bedroom. Now she wants more of this series like the Sydney Opera House.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Jones

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: This was a fun easy put together with my son. He is 10 followed instructions and was fun for us to do. He has it displayed proudly in his room. If your new to legos I would start at something a bit less.
customer_reviews.author: Joe becker

customer_reviews.title: Great to display.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandson, who gave it to my 50 year old daughter who loved it. Finished it in an hour or two and she said the instructions were very good. This is classy enough to display on a shelf. Very nicely done.
customer_reviews.author: Bookbam

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with this particular set
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other Lego Architecture projects, this one frustrated my 8 year old. The end product is a wobbly Eiffel Tower that took a lot of convincing to build. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RT3

customer_reviews.title: Great low cost set.
customer_reviews.text: This was fun to build and took about ninety minutes. I had no missing pieces as others have described and all connections are perfectly aligned and secured. Sorry about the flash in the photo. That’s London next to it. Also fun.
customer_reviews.author: J. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great for 11 year old boy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 11 year old to use in his enrichment class as a model while they were learning about Paris. He loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Good model for lego lovers.
customer_reviews.text: my son loves the architecture sets & this was a Christmas present. Being advanced builder was a good hour and he loves it to this day.
customer_reviews.author: Zhouse

customer_reviews.title: Lego Obsessed
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for a 10 year old girl who loves Legos but not the girly ones. She loved this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great product, well done
customer_reviews.text: great product, well done. My only complaint is that we had several missing pieces. Very careful to inventory our parts. As is our experience there are usually several extra pieces but never have we had missing parts in a set. Able to purchase replacement parts from an ebay vendor to finish the set. Not sure what recourse I have in getting the replacement parts from Lego, so I bought them online for a few bucks. I'm just guessing this was a rare occurrence.
customer_reviews.author: T. Frisco

customer_reviews.title: Solid Lego Set. Numbered bags would be useful.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set of my girlfriend who really likes France. She really enjoyed building this set. Her only complaint was the the 4 bags that contained the pieces were not numbered like the majority of other Lego sets. To make it worse, pieces of all 4 bags were required for all stages of building.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great for first time adult LEGO enthusiasts. Also makes a nice art piece after built.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful collectible! It was my his ands first ‘adult’ LEGO set. He got it to work on when he would get home from work to get his mind off the day. It’s now in his office and it looks almost like an art piece.
customer_reviews.author: C. Marr

customer_reviews.title: Eiffel tower legos
customer_reviews.text: Perfect Christmas gift for my 12 yr old granddaughter, shes very bright, smart, had this built less 2 hours
customer_reviews.author: debbie sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Cool Set for a Lover of Paris
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves Paris and was excited to get this for her 9th birthday. She did struggle a bit with putting together a few parts however the hardest part was keeping it together. It tends to come apart when being transported.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Hamilton Myers

customer_reviews.title: Cool lego set
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 9yr old daughter and she loved it!! Had a little trouble with the build instructions, my only tiny gripe but nothing major. Looks great put together and sitting on her desk. After this one she has begun to collect them now.
customer_reviews.author: Greg P.

customer_reviews.title: Lego Mania!
customer_reviews.text: My son built this in an hour or less. He's really good at these. Definitely a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: Giselle Crystal Forde

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful designed lego set
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful designed lego set. I think this set is by far nicer than any of the others in its series. The only think I would recommend is to use camelcamelcamel.com to check and make sure the price isnt inflated before purchasing. This item randomly goes crazy high in price and at around $40-$50 its worth it to check if your local toys r us has it in stock.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than the city skyline Lego models
customer_reviews.text: Larger than expected. I wish the other Lego architecture sets (like the city skylines) were large like this. It's not easy to assemble but not terribly difficult. Looks great when completed.
customer_reviews.author: SPS

customer_reviews.title: Good Gift Item
customer_reviews.text: This is a good gift idea for someone who likes to build things. A little expensive, but it's good quality. Bought another Lego Architecture set the next year.
customer_reviews.author: JBL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for hubby!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, alone with a few other sets, for my husband for our anniversary. Each set was a place that we had visited together. He really, really enjoyed this. Even more then I expected him to! This was terribly difficult but it wasn't so easy that it bored him either. I believe he spent a good 45 mins to an hour building it. I will be buying him more sets soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jordynn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for teen to adult
customer_reviews.text: Teenage son loves these. Wants to collect them all. Lego came up an educational toy for older kids that is a collector item showpiece that is challenging.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They love it, i was not aware that Lego had ...
customer_reviews.text: Hi,I purchased this item for a family member for there brithday.They love it ,i was not aware that Lego had such architectural structures, like this one,and many others.just kerp it going lets get back to a time were we have our kids use there brain power .it doesn't matter who you are let your mine fly .Thanks for.bringing back fun in toys.that are not toys.but are for all ages.
customer_reviews.author: satinkat

customer_reviews.title: My Husband Fangirled.
customer_reviews.text: Happy Spouse, Happy House. He had so much fun, i was kind of jealous.
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lego set for my 13year old grandson and he sent a note thanking me and said it was fun making it!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Bagley

customer_reviews.title: Nice set!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this set! I built this in about an hour and 20 min. My 7 year old daughter was eager to help. I would buy other Architecture sets in the future. The book included in wonderful, however, the book was falling apart after going page by page for directions. It would be nice if LEGO would make a separate instruction booklet from the historical facts. Just a thought.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: Fun LEGO Architecture addition
customer_reviews.text: Super cute, fun build. Didn’t take very long for 12yo builder.
customer_reviews.author: D. Humphreys

customer_reviews.title: My son loved it, we enjoyed building it together and it ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loved it, we enjoyed building it together and it looks pretty cool. I actually wanted to buy one for myself to bring to my office.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a hour
customer_reviews.text: My nephew loved it. Gave this to him for a Christmas present. He is 7 years old and love building Lego...took him only a hour to build. Now what is he going to do with that?!
customer_reviews.author: ms

customer_reviews.title: Great for Lego lovers and Paris Theme rooms!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter for Christmas and she loves it! She got into legos this year and we redid her room in a Paris theme over the summer. Directions are very clear and its very sturdy. It will be used as a decoration in her room. Very happy with it and she's 9!!!
customer_reviews.author: T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: 15 year old loved
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but we always love our legos. He’s 15 and this was a welcome set as the others are childish.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: My 10 year old son loved these very much
customer_reviews.text: We are not new to the LEGO brand. My 10 year old son loved these very much. The directions weren't clear on some instances so I had to help him figure it out. For a master builder like himself I thought that was odd. Whatever the case, that's the only reason why I didn't give this 5 stars. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a lego-loving boy!
customer_reviews.text: Although this was a little difficult to finish with the arches, my son absolutely loves this. It was a birthday gift and he started putting it together immediately. We both highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Shai Flores

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful  when finished !
customer_reviews.text: Looks great after assembly ! A good size too not tiny or too large either just right!👍🏻👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: A Busby

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loved this - she is a Lego fan her whole ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loved this - she is a Lego fan her whole life. She was thrilled to received this for her birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3.5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice set, but not a lot of pieces for the price and too simple/easy. I realize all Lego sets are overpriced, but the Architecture sets take that a step further. I think we'll be sticking to Nanoblocks for our architecture fixes in the future. The sets are tiny, but they come with many pieces and are challenging.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Son loved it... To be honest.. I loved it as well. The info book about the Tower was unexpected.
customer_reviews.author: KAllen

customer_reviews.title: One of Lego Architecture's Best
customer_reviews.text: I own and have built all of the sets in the Architecture series. This one was my favorite to build and my favorite to look at. I have found that all of the sets in this series are pretty well designed. But I think the design of this one is best. It's unmistakably the Eiffel Tower when finished.
customer_reviews.author: Theo

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my Granddaughter and she loved it. She put it together and it now sits in her room
customer_reviews.author: blackcat

customer_reviews.title: Instructions
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 9 year old son. A bit more complicated than we thought, he’ll get it done eventually!!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Everything was included!!!!
customer_reviews.text: All of the pueces were here, and directions were very clear, had it together in 30 min very easy,
customer_reviews.author: NateMcBeans

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice kit for the price. It took me about one hour to put it together with the "help" of my 7 year old. I do have a lot of practice putting Legos together so your time may be a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking when completed-needed some adult assistance.
customer_reviews.text: Nice-daughter did need help from Daddy (she's 8). Wants to pop apart if picked up to move, so if you don't want to deal with it, add a little glue at platform areas, perhaps?! It's on a shelf in our house, neat looking :)
customer_reviews.author: RDHandMomOf2

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun
customer_reviews.text: This lego architecture project provided tons of fun for a few hours. Simple and easy to put together. Instructions provided were very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Sk8brd

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend it because it is too easy for an adult ...
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend it because it is too easy for an adult to build it. It takes about 15 minutes. And also, it is very small.
customer_reviews.author: Burhan Siginc

customer_reviews.title: One of the best LEGO architecture yet.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best LEGO piece ever. I gifted it to my girlfriend as a present and she loved it. It looks really simple from the outside but while building it you realise the amount of precision and detail they have given to the product. It takes around 2 hours to make the architecture if you follow the instructions clearly. Overall, this was my best LEGO experience and definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Vivek

customer_reviews.title: He is a super lego enthusiast and has a whole wall (15 feet ...
customer_reviews.text: Grandson put this together in just over an hour. He is a super lego enthusiast and has a whole wall (15 feet wide and 8 feet high). He loves this.
customer_reviews.author: havingfun

customer_reviews.title: Missing Pieces
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a while ago for a gift, and I realized that the pieces were missing! The person that I gifted this to could not even finish building the Eiffel Tower. I recommend to buy somewhere else because this is not acceptable!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: The best birthday ever
customer_reviews.text: The perfect way to make a young boy with an architect for a Father, birthday wishes all come true. Although little Luke was only seven, he put it together without any help in about an hour
customer_reviews.author: NancyTitus Sperduti

customer_reviews.title: So beautiful! This was definitely one my Amazon best buys
customer_reviews.text: So beautiful! This was definitely one my Amazon best buys. It's as beautiful as the picture on the box. A start of a new hobby for me.
customer_reviews.author: E.Fry

customer_reviews.title: A++ for design and construct quality.
customer_reviews.text: Srsly, srsly awesome. My nieces jumped on this amongst a pile of gifts...worked together, disassembled it and rebuilt it separately. A++ for design and construct quality.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.

customer_reviews.title: This was a great gift for my son
customer_reviews.text: This was a great gift for my son, we assembled it together with ease. He is very proud of his Eiffel Tower!
customer_reviews.author: KME

customer_reviews.title: and comes with a very really nice booklet with history and information on the actual tower's ...
customer_reviews.text: I did this with my 6-year-old and (almost) 5-year-old. Very elegant set, neat design, and comes with a very really nice booklet with history and information on the actual tower's construction.
customer_reviews.author: HollyRN

customer_reviews.title: I gave it to my daughter-in-law for a Christmas present ...
customer_reviews.text: I gave it to my daughter-in-law for a Christmas present and she is an architect. She had it put together and put it on her desk at work all in one night.

customer_reviews.title: Architecture Lego Series is Great
customer_reviews.text: My daughter took a trip with her class to Paris and I got this as a present for her. I love the architecture series. I would definitely buy more.

customer_reviews.title: Son is very proud!
customer_reviews.text: These things are expensive but worth it. My son has great pride in his Eiffel Tower. It will surely be a part of our decor for years to come.

customer_reviews.title: Very giftable
customer_reviews.text: A little over priced but a nice gift to decorate the office space

customer_reviews.text: Wish it could be couple more inch taller, otherwise awesomely featured and easy to build structure

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves this!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves the architectural legos. They seem kind of pricey for the small statue.

customer_reviews.title: LEGO'S are the best and this did not disappoint

customer_reviews.title: However the Eiffel Tower is my least favorite. It looks childish in its design
customer_reviews.text: I am really fond of the Lego architecture series. However the Eiffel Tower is my least favorite. It looks childish in its design,lacks details and does not have any wow factor to it.

customer_reviews.title: It was so much fun to make and it was very educational and it's ...
customer_reviews.text: It was so much fun to make and it was very educational and it's also a beautiful decoration. I gave it a five because I love Paris and this was one of my favorite Christmas gifts ever.
customer_reviews.author: Garrick

customer_reviews.title: Lego for adults - what's not to like
customer_reviews.text: Great office desk ornament. It was easy to build but still brought me back to my younger years. People that see it always compliment the structure.
customer_reviews.author: Floridafan86

customer_reviews.title: He loved it so I would highly recommend this
customer_reviews.text: My son in law makes all of these landmarks and I went with the Architecture one as he doesn't have any. I was surprised that he finished it one day at work so this Christmas I will really have to shop for something that takes more time. He loved it so I would highly recommend this.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it zero stars I would. Very very difficult to put this together and trust me I have a vast collection of the Legos Architecture structures. Some pieces were missing. It was a mess. I would return it if I could. Awful!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old son loved building this and loves its size!
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Daniels

customer_reviews.title: This was a perfect gift for our 6-year old grandson
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect gift for our 6-year old grandson. He likes being challenged, and since he's been a Lego fan from age 2, he can assemble them on his own. I thought he might be interested in knowing about this iconic structure, so I got him an age-appropriate book to go with this set: Gustave Eiffel's Spectacular Idea: The Eiffel Tower. He loved both - and he wants to go to Paris now :-)
customer_reviews.author: falconflight

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool and yet fun
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my granddaughter for Christmas. She loves it so much that she has built it several times.
customer_reviews.author: Gma

customer_reviews.title: Lovely structure!
customer_reviews.text: Our fou- year old granddaughter asked for this as a birthday gift. She had some help assembling it I think, but it's still very nice anesthesia very proud of it!
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Lee

customer_reviews.title: Fun build
customer_reviews.text: Totally worth it, except for a few missing pieces. But that didn’t come in the way of integrity of structure.

customer_reviews.title: My 9 year old loved this set and it is very realistic
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old loved this set and it is very realistic. She needed a little guidance but was able to do most of it herself. I thought this was one of the better kits for the architecture series.
customer_reviews.author: BLS FL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift but I am sure nephew will enjoy assembling it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Gates

customer_reviews.title: fun and well received
customer_reviews.text: My nephew loves this series and immediately builds them when he receives them. He has about 9 of the series on display and they are a source of pride and of education.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Very cool LEGO set for architecture/engineering  buffs
customer_reviews.text: This is a very neat LEGO architecture set. It is a quick easy build, and it looks really cool once completed.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Fun but too simple
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 8 year old after he and I created a balsa wood Eiffel Tower model. I thought it would be a nice tie-in for him. He zipped through it much faster than I thought he would, and didn't get too much out of it. I expected it to be more complex--maybe that's a flaw on my end.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Another winner
customer_reviews.text: We have been constructing these since they started - excellent in all areas. Best gifts for an architect who has everything. He has had fun opening up about his work and others through these kits. The kids now understand dad's work.
customer_reviews.author: fairenough

product_meta.title: LEGO Architecture 21019 The Eiffel Tower
product_meta.description: Presenting the LEGO Architecture interpretation of one of the most iconic landmarks ever constructed - The Eiffel Tower! Designed and built by French entrepreneur, Gustave Eiffel, the original 324-meter-tall masterpiece of wrought iron engineering formed the grand entrance to the 1889 World's Fair, held in Paris to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the French Revolution. During construction, the 18,038 wrought iron elements making up the tower's lattice structure were bolted together at Eiffel's factory on the outskirts of Paris, before being transported to the site, hoisted into place by steam-powered cranes operating from the elevator shafts and assembled using no less than 2.5 million individual rivets. The resulting structure was extremely rigid and over the years has withstood storms, floods and everything else mother nature has thrown at it. Today, The Eiffel Tower is one of the world's most popular landmarks, attracting millions of curious visitors from around the world each year. With this exceptional model, you can now build your very own 321-piece Eiffel Tower in LEGO brick form and display it in your home, office or wherever you like!
feature_bullets: Build a detailed model of the Eiffel Tower in Paris, France!
Includes collectible booklet containing information about the design, architecture and history of the building
LEGO Architecture building toys are compatible with all LEGO construction sets for creative building
The Eiffel Tower measures 12 inches high, 4 inches wide, and 4 inches deep
321 pieces – For boys and girls over the age of 12 years old
